div1.p: I am very pleased that you have agreed to appear in three television programs for University of Nebraska Television. We have long been anxious to work out an arrangement with you to make some programs which will be recorded on video-tape and then transferred to film for permanent usage. Your ideas on the content for each of the three programs sound excellent.

When would it be convenient to accomplish this work? Could we tape the programs while you are in Lincoln for the ceremonies accompanying the placing of the bust in the state capitol? As Phyllis stated, we can pay your expenses for the trip up here. I wish we were in a position to pay you much more, but I'm sure you are familiar with University budgets. Ours is no exception.

We are really looking forward to working with you, Dr. Neihardt! Let me know when you can be available for the taping sessions. Also, if there are any objects of interest you wish to use on the programs,--any books, or pictures, or maps, etc. that we can have prepared in advance -- let me know, and we'll make every effort to get whatever you wish.
I am looking forward to hearing from you.
